description: Proposed Free-Standing Illuminated Advertising Panel with a single digital display
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2d73c7b6-7fff-a956-ff66-c6f16e304628"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed illuminated advertisement, by reason of its scale, appearance, location and potential uses would result in an obstructive and intrusive form of development that would obstruct the pavement and create distractions for vehicular users, to the detriment of highway and pedestrian safety. As such the proposed development is contrary to policy D8 'Public Realm' and T2 'Healthy Streets' of the London Plan (2021) as well as policy PP1 'Public Realm', LP7 'Advertisements', LP41 ‘Liveable Neighbourhoods’ and LP42 'Walking and Cycling' of the Hackney Local Plan.</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f9e05eaf-7fff-1890-c1f7-7970f987b760"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed illuminated advertisement would represent an incongruous visual intrusion to the street scene and contribute to an unsightly proliferation and clutter of signage and street furniture in the local area, that would detract from the visual amenity of the street scene, harm character and appearance of the local area. As such, the proposal would be contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP1 (Design quality and local character) and LP7 (Advertisements) of Hackney's Local Development Plan (2020).</span></span></p>
